get.description: The status endpoint can be used to perform an authenticated request to verify the access token is valid and that the service is operational.

Retrieve details of the current user's account.

Access tokens are scoped to a single user account and team _(if they are a member of more than one)_. This endpoint can be used to determine which user the access token was issued for.

To retrieve details of the user's role within their current team, refer to **[Retrieve team membership](#operation/get-team-me)**.

patch.description:
Update the current user's account details.

When updating a user's email address, the change must be confirmed by the user via an email sent to their current email address. The updated email address won't be reflected in the response until the confirmation is complete.

It is not possible to update a user's password using the API.

get.description:
List all teams the current user is a member of.

A user can be a member of multiple teams. To retrieve details of the team the access token is scoped to, refer to **[Retrieve current team](#operation/get-team)**.
Returns basic details of the current team.

patch.description: Updates basic details of the current team.

get.description:
Retrieve membership details for the user's current team.

To retrieve the user's basic details, refer to **[Retrieve user account](#operation/get-me)**.
List all team members of the current team.

Returns a paginated list of clients.

To retrieve a client, refer to **[Retrieve a client](#operation/get-clients-id)**.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search for clients by name (first, middle and last), reference and organisation name. Search is case-insensitive and fuzzy.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter clients by their current status.

parameters.name: visibility
parameters.description: Filter clients by their visibility state. Both active and archived clients are returned by default.

parameters.description: Filter records assigned to this team member's user ID.

parameters.description:
Filter users by reference.

This search is case-insensitive but is not fuzzy and will only return full matches.

parameters.name: order_by

Unique client identifier

Update the details of a client.

To add or update a client's address, refer to **[Replace an address for a client](#operation/put-clients-id-address)**.

parameters.description: Unique client identifier.

get.description: Retrieve address for a client.

put.summary: Replace an address for a client

Replace address for a client.

Each country has its own field requirements. Any field can become required if the selected country demands it, most commonly `postcode`.

parameters.description: Unique client identifier.

get.summary: List all assignees for a client
get.description: Returns a paginated list of the client's assignees.

post.description:
Add one or more assignees to a client, merging them with existing assignees.

Existing assignees to the client are not included in the response. Only added assignees to the client will be returned.

To replace assignees, refer to **[Replace assignees for a client](#operation/put-clients-id-assignees)**.

team_member.description: The unique identifier of the team member to be assigned to the client.

type.description: The type of assignee to be assigned to the client.

201.description: Created (one or more assignees to the client have been added)

204.description: No Content (no new assignees to the client have been added)

errors: The submitted value must be an array of assignee objects

put.description:
Replace all existing assignees for a client.

Existing assignees to the client that are included in the request will be part of the updated assignees to the client but they will not be shown in the response. Only added assignees will be returned.

To add additional assignees without replacing existing, refer to **[Add assignees for a client](#operation/post-clients-id-assignees)**.

team_member.description: The unique identifier of the team member to be assigned to the client.

type.description: The type of assignee to be assigned to the client.

201.description: Created (one or more assignees to the client have been replaced)

204.description: No Content (assignees to the client have been successfully deleted or there are no changes)

errors: The submitted value must be an array of assignee objects

delete.description:
Remove all assignees from a client.

To delete a single client assignee, see **[Delete an assignee for a client](#operation/delete-clients-clientId-assignees-assigneeId)**.

delete.summary: Delete an assignee for a client
delete.description:
Remove an assignee from a client.

To delete all client assignees, see **[Delete assignees for a client](#operation/delete-clients-id-assignees)**.

parameters.description: Unique client identifier

get.summary: List all organisations for a client
get.description:
Returns a paginated list of a client's organisation memberships. When an organisation is archived all clients associated with the organisation will be removed.

To retrieve organisations for the team, refer to **[List all organisations](#operation/get-organisations)**.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: Sort results by organisation name. Results returned in created order by default.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Order results in ascending or descending order. Results returned in ascending order by default.

post.description:
Add the client to one or more organisations, merging them with existing organisation memberships. Existing organisation memberships are not included in the response. Only added organisation memberships will be returned.

To replace organisations, refer to **[Replace organisations for a client](#operation/put-clients-id-organisations)**.

To update an organisation's basic details, refer to **[Update an organisation](#operation/patch-organisations-id)**.

201.description: Created (one or more organisations to the client have been added)

4117 pre-exists.description: Membership to 4117 already existed before the request.

new.description: Membership to 3970 and 4117 did not exist before the request.

204.description: No Content (no new organisations to the client have been added)

errors: At least one organisation is required

put.description:
Replaces a client's organisation memberships. Existing organisation memberships that are included in the request will be part of the updated organisation memberships, but they will not be shown in the response. Only added organisations will be returned.

To add additional organisations without replacing existing, refer to **[Add organisations for a client](#operation/post-clients-id-organisations)**.

201.description: Created (one or more organisations to the client have been replaced)

204.description: No Content (organisations to the client have been successfully deleted or there are no changes)

errors: At least one organisation is required

delete.description: Delete all of a client's organisation memberships.
Delete a single client organisation membership.

name.description:
Full or partial name

The value is not formatted (e.g. title case), and appears as written.

is_verified.description: `true` once a new user has verified their email address

is_disabled.description:
`true` when a user account has been disabled

User accounts disabled due to failed login attempts are automatically re-enabled after a delay. Please contact support@amiqus.co for further details.

created_at.description: Date and time the user account was created

updated_at.description: Date and time the user's details were last updated

oneOf.description: The value will be `null` when the team member is no longer part of the team.

status.description: A status can be set to signify a decision has been made by a team member on the outcome of the client's checks.

name.description:
The client's names.

Includes automatic compilations of the client's full name for display purposes.

reference.description: An external reference or identifier to cross-reference with your system.

national_insurance_number.description:
Client's National Insurance number.

_This feature may not be enabled for all teams._

is_deletable.description: Indicates if the client can be deleted.

created_at.description: Date and time the client was created.

updated_at.description: Date and time the client's details were last updated.

archived_at.description: Date and time the client was archived.

unit.description: Unit, flat or apartment name or number.

street_name.description: First line of the street name.

second_street.description: Second line of the street name if applicable.

district.description: District, town, village, suburb or equivalent.

province.description: Province, county, municipality, township or equivalent.

name.description:
Organisation or company name
The value is not formatted (e.g. title case), and appears as written.

company_number.description: The company registration number or reference

jurisdiction.description:
The country code or region where the company is registered.

Required if `company_number` is provided.

created_at.description: Date and time the organisation was created

updated_at.description: Date and time the organisation's details were last updated

archived_at.description: Date and time the organisation was archived.

status.description:
The overall status of the record.

Status is determined by the combined states of a record's steps, expiry and review:
- `pending`: Active without any completed steps
- `started`: Active with at least one completed step
- `complete`: All steps completed
- `incomplete`: Expired with at least one completed step
- `waiting`: At least one check step is awaiting results
- `failed`: _Deprecated_
- `empty`: Expired without any completed steps
- `paused`: At least one paused check step
- `amendments`: Pending record amendment approval or rejection
- `reviewed`: Record marked as having been reviewed

perform_url.description: The unique URL to complete the record steps in a browser.

oneOf.description: Value is `false` when none of the steps are available for submission due to completion, expiry or for any other reason.

email.description:
Contact email address for this record.

New request and reminder emails (if enabled) and completion receipts are sent to this email address. It is a snapshot of the client email address taken at the time the record was created or re-sent.

oneOf.description: Unique client identifier.

steps.description: List of complete and incomplete steps.

has_reminders.description: Denotes the presence/absence of email reminders.

created_at.description: Date and time the record was created.

updated_at.description: Date and time the record's details were last updated or a step was completed.

expired_at.description: Date and time that the record will expire.

archived_at.description: Date and time the record was archived.

result.description: The overall result of the properties checked in this breakdown. Where no result is returned the value will be `null`. Where an invalid value is returned the default is `consider`.
The result of the individual sub-breakdown property. Where no result is returned the value will be `null`. Where an invalid value is returned the default is `consider`.

nfc.description: If a document's NFC chip was scanned for this report, the data extracted from it will be included here.

anyOf.description: The document either didn't have NFC or its NFC chip was not scanned.

result.description:
* `clear` - All verifications pass. There are no indications the document is fraudulent.
* `consider` - Some verifications did not pass. Doesn't necessarily point to a suspected document (for example, expired document).
* `suspected` - Document shows signs of suspect fraud.
* `rejected` - Unable to process the document image, or the document isn't supported. Also if the age of the applicant is too low.

breakdown.description: A detailed breakdown of the report's verifications used to determine the overall result.

age_validation.description: Whether the age calculated from the document's date of birth is greater than or equal to the minimum accepted age. The minimum accepted age is 16 years.

minimum_accepted_age.description: Whether the minimum accepted age was met.

compromised_document.description: Whether the image of the document has been previously flagged as compromised.

document_database.description: Whether the document is known to be compromised.

repeat_attempts.description: Whether the document has been reused in a suspicious way.

data_comparison.description: Whether the data provided by the client matches the data extracted from the document.

first_name.description: Whether the client's first name matched the value extracted from the document.

last_name.description: Whether the client's last name matched the value extracted from the document.

date_of_birth.description:
Whether the client's date of birth matched the value extracted from the document.

If the document didn't contain a date of birth, no comparison was made and the result is `null`.

data_consistency.description:
Whether data represented in multiple places on the document is consistent. For example, between MRZ lines and OCR extracted text on passports.

If a document's NFC chip is scanned, data consistency is not checked so property value is `null`.

breakdown.description: Where a breakdown property result is `null`, the field wasn't present in at least two places on the document.

data_validation.description: Whether the format and length of the fields are correct for that document type.

expiry_date.description: Whether the format of the expiry date is invalid.

image_integrity.description:
Whether the document was of sufficient quality to perform validation.

If a document's NFC chip is scanned, image integrity is not checked so property value is `null`.

supported_document.description: Whether the submitted document is a supported type.

image_quality.description:
Whether the image of the document's data points and features were clear.

A `consider` result means that parts of the image were obscured, unclear, damaged or missing.

An `unidentified` result means that not enough quality is present in the image to be processed.

colour_picture.description: Whether the document image was in colour. Black and white images are flagged with a `consider` result.

conclusive_document_quality.description: Is the document of sufficient quality to perform a fraud inspection. A `consider` result means that we cannot positively say the document is fraudulent or not.

issuing_authority.description:
Whether data on the document matches the issuing authority data.

If a document's NFC chip is not scanned the property value is `null`.

nfc_passive_authentication.description: Whether the document NFC chip is original or cloned.

nfc_active_authentication.description: Whether the document NFC chip data has been tampered with.

police_record.description: Whether the document has been identified as lost, stolen or otherwise compromised. Applies to all UK documents or any document that has been reported stolen in the UK.

visual_authenticity.description:
Whether visual (non-textual) elements are correct for this specific document type.

If a document's NFC chip is scanned, data consistency is not checked so property value is `null`.

face_detection.description: No face was detected on the document.

digital_tampering.description: Indication of digital tampering in the image (for example, name was altered).

original_document_present.description: The document was not present when the photo was taken. For example, a photo of an image of a document or a photo of a digital screen.

document_on_printed_paper.description: Image is a photo of a printed image of a document.

photo_of_screen.description: Image is a photo of a digital screen.

scan.description: Image of document was captured using a scanner (not a photo of a document).

picture_face_integrity.description: The pictures of the person identified on the document show signs of tampering or alteration. In most cases this will focus on the primary picture yet it may also apply to the secondary and tertiary pictures when documents contain them.

security_features.description: Security features expected on the document are missing or are incorrect.

fonts.description: Fonts on the document don't match the expected ones.

template.description: The document doesn't match the expected template for the document type and country it is from.

anyOf.description: No data could be extracted from the document.

result.description:
* `clear` - All verifications pass.
* `consider` - Some verifications did not pass.

breakdown.description: A detailed breakdown of the report's verifications used to determine the overall result.

face_comparison.description: Whether the face in the document matches the face in the motion capture.

face_match.description: Comparison between face in document and motion capture was sufficient.

score.description: Similarity between face in document and motion capture, where 1 is a perfect match.

image_integrity.description: Whether the quality and integrity of the uploaded files were sufficient to perform a face comparison.

face_detected.description: A single face of good enough quality was found in both the document image and the motion capture.

source_integrity.description: Whether the motion capture is trustworthy, e.g. not from a fake webcam.

visual_authenticity.description: Whether the person in the motion capture is real and that actions were performed live.

liveness_detected.description: Whether the liveness actions were correctly executed by the data subject.

spoofing_detection.description: Whether the motion capture is not a spoof, e.g. video of a digital screen.

score.description: Probability motion capture is genuine, where 1 is highest confidence it is genuine.

result.description:
* `clear` - All verifications pass.
* `consider` - Some verifications did not pass.

breakdown.description: A detailed breakdown of the report's verifications used to determine the overall result.

face_comparison.description: Whether the face in the document matches the face in the photo.

face_match.description: Comparison between face in document and photo was sufficient.

image_integrity.description: Whether the quality and integrity of the uploaded files were sufficient to perform a face comparison.

face_detected.description: A single face of good enough quality was found in both the document image and the photo.

source_integrity.description: Whether the photo is trustworthy, e.g. not digitally manipulated, from a fake webcam, an old photo.

visual_authenticity.description: Whether the person in the photo appears to be real.

spoofing_detection.description: Whether the photo is not a spoof, e.g. photo of a digital screen or printed photo.

score.description: Probability photo is genuine, where 1 is highest confidence it is genuine.

side.description:
For documents with more than one side, e.g. UK DVLA driving licence.

Some documents with only one side may still include a "front" value, e.g. UK passport.

has_nfc.description: If the document has an NFC chip and its chip was scanned.

result.description:
* `clear` - All reports returned clear.
* `consider` - At least one report contains a consider result.

reports.description: The reports performed for this Photo ID check.

type.description: This report type is not yet available from the API.

anyOf.description: The reports for this check have not yet been processed.

object.description: The response for this check type is not yet available from the API.

response.description: Check responses are still in beta. Available data may be incomplete or differ from the specification. Contact developers@amiqus.co to report inconsistencies.

oneOf.description: Value is `true` when there is an expandable response available.
Value is `null` when there is no expandable response available.

enable_payment.title: Pass on fee
enable_payment.description: Require the person to pay for the processing of this check.

enable_payment.title: Pass on fee
enable_payment.description: Require the person to pay for the processing of this check.

free_volunteer.title: Reduced rate COVID-19 application
free_volunteer.description: This check will cost 1 credit for eligible roles when responding to COVID-19.

enable_payment.title: Pass on fee
enable_payment.description: Require the person to pay for the processing of this check.

free_volunteer.title: Reduced rate COVID-19 application
free_volunteer.description: This check will cost 1 credit for eligible roles when responding to COVID-19.

enable_payment.title: Pass on fee
enable_payment.description: Require the person to pay for the processing of this check.

payment_amount.description:
The amount the person will pay for the processing of this check.

`null` if person is not required to pay for the processing of this check.

oneOf.description: Value is a cent integer, e.g. 1437  14.37

credit_cost.description:
The number of credits deducted to run this check.

`null` if the default credit cost should be used to run the check.

cancel.description: Let this check be cancelled while in a `paused` state.

replay.description: Enable "re-submit" action when check has failed.

state.description: Automatically set the check status without carrying out a request.

barring_adults.title: Adults
barring_adults.description:
Include adult barring lists.

Required if `barring_children: false`

barring_children.title: Children
barring_children.description:
Include child barring lists.

Required if `barring_adults: false`

face.description: Request a photograph of this person to compare against their ID document.

liveness.description: Ask this person to present a unique code when taking their photograph to help verify they are the one carrying out the check.

facial_similarity.description:
Biometric analysis to verify document ownership, compared against a photo or motion video of the person performing the request.

**Costs +1 Additional credit**

live_document.description:
Ask this person to take a photo of their document with a smartphone or tablet device.

_This feature may not be enabled for all teams._

issuing_countries.description: Accept documents issued by only these countries.

right_to_work.description: For right to work in the UK (`GBR`), the `docs` property must include a `passport`.

issuing_countries.description: Accept documents issued by only these countries.

allow_fallback.description: If the person does not have a passport with a working NFC chip, allow them to continue to verify their other ID document.

timeframe.description: The number of years of required activity history.

gap_threshold.description: Maximum number of days between activities before an explanation is required.

supporting_evidence.description:
Activity types requiring supporting evidence.

_This feature may not be enabled for all teams._

review_references.description:
Review reference details before they are sent to referees.

_This feature may not be enabled for all teams._

referee_form.description: Add a form reference UUID to include a form to collect more details from referees.

balance.description: Include balances for each connected account.

oneOf.description: Months of transactions to fetch for each connected account.
Do not retrieve transactions for each connected account.

silent.description:
When `false` this person will be asked to agree before the check is run, otherwise they will not be notified.

_Setting this preference may not be available for all teams._

monitor.description: Continually monitor changes to the check results for one or three years.

oneOf.description:
Continually monitor changes to the check results for one or three years.

**Costs 12 additional credits**
Disable ongoing monitoring.

search_profile.description:
Specifies the search profile to use for the watchlist check.

**PEPs, sanctions and adverse media : +1 additional credit**\
**PEPs and sanctions and only : +1 additional credit**

type.description: Forms are either for internal data collection (`internal`), or are requested for completion by the client (`requested`).

fields.description: The first field must always be a Section. Any Fields not present in a Section are omitted.

show_if.description: An object keyed by the field ID of a **Single Choice** or **Multiple Choice** field and its desired value to activate this field. Cannot be used if this field is present in another field's `show_if` property.

expires_at.description: The date and time an uploaded file expires.
The date and time an uploaded file expires.

client.description: The client associated with this correction.

oneOf.description: Unique client identifier.

record.description: The record associated with this correction.

oneOf.description: Unique record identifier.

created_at.description: Date and time the correction was created.

updated_at.description: Date and time the correction was last updated.

steps.description: Steps to be completed by the client.

notification.description: Enable or disable a "New Request" notification to the client.

message.description:
Include a message for client.

Message is shown to the client before they begin the first step. It is also included in an email notification, if sent.

reminder.description:
Enable or disable email reminders.

When enabled, the client is sent a reminder email every 2 days until all steps have been completed, the record expires or is archived.

oneOf.description: A `null` value indicates the preferences for the invalid step could not be assessed.

additionalProperties.description: Can be any valid preference property value including string, number, boolean, array or object.

Each property may contain more than one validation error

The property name references to the property's dot-notated path within the corresponding `preset_step` object:

**E.g. A step preference is no longer available**
```json
{
  "preferences.liveness": ['Preference no longer available']
}
```

**E.g. A step type is not available the team**
```json
{
  "type": ['Step type check.watchlist is not available for this team']
}
```

presets.title: Record Template Presets
presets.description: Settings and steps configured for this template.

assignees.description: IDs of team members assigned to the Record.

secret.description: Shared secret key used to sign webhook payloads.

events.description: The event or events this webhook is subscribed to. Supports wildcards; `*` all events, `client.*` all client events, etc.

is_enabled.description: Whether or not the webhook is currently enabled.

created_at.description: Date and time the webhook was created.

updated_at.description: Date and time the webhook was last updated.

fields.description: The first field must always be a Section. Any Fields not present in a Section are omitted.

token.description: A JSON Web Token, valid for `60` minutes.

record_id.description: The SDK Token is scoped for this individual Record only.

ClientCaseStatus.title: Case Status
ClientCaseStatus.description:
The overall status of the case.

- `pending`: Active, awaiting approval or rejection.
- `on_hold`: Inactive, on hold.
- `approved`: Completed and approved.
- `rejected`: Completed and rejected.

created_at.description: Date and time the case item was added to the case.

updated_at.description: Date and time the case item's details were last updated.

oneOf.description: The unique client identifier.

created_at.description: Date and time the case was created.

updated_at.description: Date and time the case's details were last updated.

archived_at.description: Date and time the case was archived.

oneOf.description: The unique team member identifier.

from_status.description: The previous status of the case review.

created_at.description: Date and time the case review was added.

updated_at.description: Date and time the case review details were last updated.

errors: At least one property is required

enum: File scan is not yet complete
File scan could not be completed
